revisions.rev:
{{distinguish2|[[AVG (software)|the legitimate AVG line of antivirus programs]]}}
'''AntiVirus Gold''' is [[rogue software]] developed by [[ICommerce Solutions]] S.A. that poses as a legitimate [[antivirus program]]<ref name="ca.com">http://www.ca.com/us/securityadvisor/pest/pest.aspx?id=453094194</ref>. It attempts to persuade users to buy the software by displaying ads and other [[nagware]]. It is believed that the name of the program is an attempt at [[Social engineering (security)|social engineering]] to confuse people about the legitimate program [[AVG Anti-Virus]].
AntiVirus Gold may be downloaded as bundle with other software or by some trojans.<ref>http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/forums/topic22397.html</ref> Antivirus Gold has also been rebranded under many names such as Antivirus Golden and Antispyware Gold.<ref>http://www.spywarewarrior.com/rogue_anti-spyware.htm</ref>
== Symptoms of infection == In a typical infection, the desktop wallpaper is modified and an advertisement is displayed urging the user to buy Antivirus Gold. Upon clicking on the message, a web browser is opened to point to www.AntiVirus-Gold.com<ref name="ca.com"/>. Users have also reported that they are being directed to the site after clicking on the infected desktop. The program attempts to reinstall itself after a reboot if removed by uninstalling or system restore.<ref>http://www.symantec.com/security_response/writeup.jsp?docid=2006-032415-1558-99&tabid=2</ref>
== Removal == AntiVirus Gold is detected in common [[Anti-virus programs]], including CA Antispyware, the Norton Family of Security products, AVG Anti-Virus. Antimalware programs, such as Malwarebytes' AntiMalware, are also very effective in detecting and removing [[rogue software]] such as AntiVirus Gold.
